newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-St Barbara says wins legal points.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-St Barbara says wins legal points.

text.p: The Supreme Court of Western Australia had struck out the majority of a statement of claim against St Barbara Mines Ltd by former director Ross Atkins and his company, Montleigh Investments Pty Ltd, St Barbara said.
The only remaining issue in the proceedings was the question of whether power of attorney for a proxy form was deposited in time before St Barbara's last annual meeting, St Barbara said.
It was expected that the remaining issue would be finalised within the next four weeks, St Barbara said.

The legal proceedings were aimed at reversing the outcome of a poll of shareholders at St Barbara's last annual general meeting which resulted in Atkins not being re-elected to the board, St Barbara said.

On January 20, the Supreme Court of Western Australia struck out the majority of the Atkins/Montleigh statement of claim, and dismissed as unarguable the contention deputy chairman Peter Jones improperly acted as chairman of the AGM when he demanded that a poll be held on the re-election of Atkins, it said.
St Barbara Mines is a Western Australian gold producer.
